batch_edit_price.heading: Edit Pricing
batch_edit_price.selection: There is {{count}} part currently selected in your batch. Edit pricing for the entire batch:
batch_edit_price.selection_plural: There are {{count}} parts currently selected in your batch. Edit pricing for the entire batch:
batch_edit_price.group_gp: Do these parts belong in a group, with a special GP%?

states.no_change: No changes to the current batch.
states.list_or_optimized: Sell parts at List price or Optimized price, whichever is higher.
states.list_or_gp: Sell parts at List price or {{percent}}%, whichever is higher.

confirm_batch_price.summary: This action will update {{count}} part in the batch to:
confirm_batch_price.summary_plural: This action will update all {{count}} parts in the batch to:
confirm_batch_price.action: Click "update parts" to submit the change and clear your batch.
confirm_batch_price.success: {{count}} part is updated. Your batch is clear.
confirm_batch_price.success_plural: {{count}} parts are updated. Your batch is clear.

pricing.list_or_optimized: Sell parts at List price or Optimized price, whichever is higher.
pricing.list_or_gp: Sell parts at List price or {{percent}}%, whichever is higher.

description.part1: Choose how much you want to mark up the very least expensive parts (drain plug washers, for example) and the very most expensive (rebuilt engines, for example).
description.part2: The range for the very least expensive parts (the maximum markup) is 2.0 - 10.0.  You may enter any number within that range.  A value of 6.0 would sell a $0.25 part for $1.50.
description.part3: The range for the very most expensive parts (the minimum markup) is 1.0 - 2.0.  You may enter any number within that range.  A value of 1.5 would sell a $3000 part for $4500.

description.part1: Enter your desired Parts GP percentage. You may customize list prices on any part you wish, but the Optimizer works best when most (if not all) of your prices follow suggestions.
description.part2: Typical target is 40-60% depending on your service mix.

gp_exceptions.heading: GP Exceptions
gp_exceptions.description: Create and edit groups with special GP percentage. You can turn the Optimizer off for individual parts (or batches of parts) and assign them to a group instead. This allows you to manage types of parts (tires, 12v batteries, etc.) that can't command as high a gross profit.

group_prices.heading: Prefer Group Prices
group_prices.label: Ignore list price when a part is assigned to a group
group_prices.description: Check the box if you wish to ignore list price when a part is assigned to a group. Otherwise the part will sell at whichever price is highest: list price or group price.

optimized_prices.heading: Prefer Optimized Prices
optimized_prices.label: Ignore list price when a part has Optimizer "ON"
optimized_prices.description: Check the box if you wish to always ignore list price when a part has the Optimizer "ON". Otherwise the part will sell at whichever price is highest: list price or Optimized price.

calculating.title: Calculating Optimized prices...
calculating.body: This process usually takes less than 5 minutes to complete.

notifications.calculation_success: Optimized calculations complete! Custom markup curve created for {{shop}} for target {{percent}}% GP
notifications.calculation_failed: Optimized prices cannot be calculated. Check parameters for validity or contact {{email}}

activate.heading: Activate the Optimizer
activate.insufficient_data: Shop sales history is currently too small for the Optimizer to work effectively. Average time to generate sufficient data is 30 days running Shop-Ware.
activate.description: Once activated you can apply the Optimizer to some or all of your parts, at your discretion. Parts that do not have the Optimizer applied will still display Optimized prices for reference. Watch as Parts Gross Profit reaches your target!

modal.heading: Start the Optimizer
modal.apply_all: Apply the Optimizer to all parts now
modal.manual: Leave parts alone and apply manually
modal.clear: Clear all and apply Optimizer from scratch
modal.description: You can apply the Optimizer to all of your parts at once, or wait and apply the Optimizer later (individually or in batch).

deactivate.heading: Turn off the Optimizer
deactivate.description: Disable sell price adjustments and suggestions. The Optimizer can be reactivated anytime.

modal.body:
Are you sure you want to turn off the Optimizer?

NOTE: the application knows which parts have the Optimizer applied now. If you reactivate the Optimizer in the future those parts will have the Optimizer reapplied automatically, so you don't have to start over from scratch.

description.part1: You can apply the Optimizer to individual parts or in batch, on the Inventory page. Parts with the Optimizer ON will show a tag icon in the GP column. Parts that do not have the Optimizer applied will show their current GP percentage.
description.part2: When you edit a part, the Optimized price is always available for reference, whether the Optimizer is on for the part or not.

disabled.heading: Optimize your Parts Gross Profit
disabled.description:
Set your desired metrics and the Optimizer will automatically calculate a custom markup curve based on your shop's sales volume by parts cost and your target GP.

Like a traditional price matrix, the Optimizer marks up cheaper parts more than expensive parts. But it's smarter, using your shop's unique, real world data to deliver target profit. It adapts as your sales history changes, so profit percentage is controlled automatically.

delete_modal.there_are_more_than_one_canned_job: There are {{count}} canned jobs that use this labor rate. Those canned jobs will no longer have a specific labor rate. Delete anyway?
delete_modal.there_is_one_canned_job: There is 1 canned job that uses this labor rate. This canned job will no longer have a specific labor rate. Delete anyway?

on.optimized_price_ignores_list: Optimizer on and ignores list price; sell at Optimized price.
on.optimized_highest: Optimizer on, Optimized price highest; sell at Optimized price.
on.list_highest: Optimizer on, List price highest; sell at List price.

off.no_group: Optimizer turned off, no group assigned; sell at List price.
off.gp_price: Optimizer turned off, Group GP {{percent}}%; Group GP% higher than List GP%; sell at Group GP of {{percent}}%.
off.ignore_list: Optimizer turned off, Group GP {{percent}}%; List price ignored; sell at Group price.
off.list_price: Optimizer turned off, Group GP {{percent}}%; List GP% higher than Group GP%; sell at List price.

edit.update_and_next: Press Enter for update and next

adjustments.heading: Status and adjustments
adjustments.description:
Part allocation status is handled automatically, between repair
order, part orders, and stocking quantities.

Use the Adjust Inventory box (below) to update quantities and
their allocation status.

Click the "X" to revert your changes.

fees.heading: Automatic Part Fee Calculation
fees.description:
Configure a fee to be added automatically whenever this part is
added to a service. (The charge will appear on the same service,
under Hazmats and Fees.)

Enter a fee name; this is how the fee will appear on the service.
You may edit any fee description later (on any RO).

Percentage calculations will be off the total part sales price,
regardless of the quantity of the part.

help.description: Ex. "North Carolina Scrap Tire Disposal Tax (1%)"
help.taxable: Check box if the part fee should be taxable.

edit_location.heading: Edit Part Location
edit_location.description: There is {{count}} part currently selected in your batch. Assign a single location to all the parts in order to group them in inventory.
edit_location.description_plural: There are {{count}} parts currently selected in your batch. Assign a single location to all the parts in order to group them in inventory.

returns.heading: Create Return Order
returns.out_of_stock: One or more of the selected inventories does not have a positive on hand quantity.

notifications.no_vendor: Batch includes inventories without a vendor. Only select parts from a single vendor to place a {{type}}.
notifications.multi_vendor: Batch includes multiple vendors. Only select parts from a single vendor to place a {{type}}.

purchase_order.heading: Create Purchase Order
purchase_order.description: Place an order with this vendor now; use the contact information below. Once the order is placed, click the "Ordered" button to create a purchase order and update the status of all the listed parts.

match.heading: Match parts with same part number
match.description: The following parts have the same part numbers but different brands. Create a new part with the new brand or pick an existing part that's already in your inventory:

cj_swap.heading: Swap Parts on Canned Jobs
cj_swap.description: The part you selected is currently present on {{count}} canned job. Choose which part you want to swap with the existing part you selected:
cj_swap.description_plural: The part you selected is currently present on {{count}} canned jobs. Choose which part you want to swap with the existing part you selected:

notifications.no_canned_jobs: This part has 0 canned jobs associated. Please select another inventory.
notifications.multiple_parts: More than one part is selected. Parts on Canned Jobs can only be swapped one at a time.
notifications.core_part: Core parts cannot be swapped at Canned Jobs. Please select another inventory.
notifications.success: Success {{count}} Canned Job has been updated with replacement part {{part}}
notifications.success_plural: Success {{count}} Canned Jobs have been updated with replacement part {{part}}

search.placeholder: Search brand, description or part number...

share_estimate_email.follow_link_text: Follow the link below to view the estimate online. From there you can authorize repairs, ask questions or post comments.
share_estimate_email.prepared_estimate: We prepared an estimate to service your {{ vehicle }}.

share_invoice_email.thank_you_for_opportunity: Thank you for the opportunity to service your {{ vehicle }}.
share_invoice_email.download_copy_below: Download a copy of your invoice, which includes any service documentation. You can also view the repair order online; follow the link below.
share_invoice_email.contact_us_at: If you have any questions, please contact us anytime at {{ email }}.

share_workorder_email.checked_out_your_vehicle: We checked out your {{ vehicle }} and posted the details; click the link below to respond.
share_workorder_email.from_there_review: From there you can review any recommendations, ask questions or post comments.

share_invoice_remote_pay_email.thank_you_for_opportunity: Thank you for the opportunity to service your {{ vehicle }}.
share_invoice_remote_pay_email.invoice_ready_to_review: Your invoice is ready for your review and payment. Please follow the button below for checkout.
share_invoice_remote_pay_email.to_download_use_link: To download your invoice use this link
share_invoice_remote_pay_email.contact_us_at: If you have any questions, please contact us anytime at {{ email }}.

internal_share_email.ready_for_review: The following repair order is ready for your review. If you have not yet logged in, you will need to use the email address and password associated with the account.

search.placeholder: Search name, phone, info, or notes...

new_vendor.heading: Enter new vendor information
new_vendor.save_and_add: Hit enter to save and add another.

remove.heading: Remove Vendor
remove.unable_to_remove: Unable to delete the vendor. Please try again
remove.description: This will remove the vendor from the vendor list. Any inventory parts will be unassigned from this vendor. No existing purchase orders or purchase records will be affected (vendor will still be associated).

remove_and_reassign.heading: Remove vendor and reassign parts
remove_and_reassign.description: This will remove the vendor from the vendor list. Any inventory parts can be reassigned to an existing vendor. No existing purchase orders or purchase records will be affected (vendor will still be associated).

integration.error: Unable to confirm. Please try again.
